title: Hay testing for cow calf beef producers

tasks.task: Hay sampling and analysis process for cow-calf operations in Kentucky.
subtasks: Stockpiling tall fescue for winter grazing.
Understanding the quality of hay to supplement accordingly.
Sampling hay by lot (one field, one harvest).
Using a coring tool (probe) to get 15-20 samples per lot.
Submitting whole sample for analysis, not subdividing.
Drying hay sample overnight in a 55°C oven.
Weighing dried sample to determine dry matter.
Grinding sample through a two-stage grinder (2 mm then 1 mm screens).
Analyzing ground sample using near-infrared spectroscopy.
Evaluating forage quality parameters (crude protein, fiber, digestibility).
Using hay test results with the UK cow supplementation tool.
Determining supplemental feed requirements based on hay quality and cow stage.

tasks.task: Hay quality analysis for cow-calf operations.
subtasks: Sampling each hay field cutting for a separate lot.
Using a coring tool for at least 15-20 samples per lot.
Ensuring samples represent entire bale volume, including fines.
Drying samples at 55°C overnight to measure dry matter.
Grinding samples into a fine powder for analysis.
Analyzing forage quality parameters using near-infrared spectroscopy.
Entering data into the UK cow supplementation tool to determine needed supplements.
